content:
• Wednesday, October 17, 2012
  • S

    Sprint (NYSE:S) is working on a fancy move to take control of Clearwire without buying it,...

    Sprint (NYSE:S) is working on a fancy move to take control of Clearwire without buying it, according to sources. Instead, Sprint may cut a deal with other major Clearwire investors - including Comcast and Intel - that would allow it to appoint a majority of directors to Clearwire's board. CLWR +4.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM | 7 Comments
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD): Q3 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.12B misses by $660M....

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD): Q3 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.12B misses by $660M. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) -28.7% AH after guiding on its Q3 earnings call for Q4 revenue of...

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) -28.7% AH after guiding on its Q3 earnings call for Q4 revenue of $145M-$150M, below a $153.1M consensus. The InfiniBand switch/adapter card vendor had little margin for error after a huge 2012 run-up left it with steep multiples. Intel mentioned yesterday demand had weakened for high-end server CPUs, which Mellanox's products are often used with. The guidance could have some negative implications for Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) engineered system sales. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNBR

    More on Select Comfort (SCSS): Q3 meets on the top line and beats on the bottom line with a 23%...

    More on Select Comfort (SCSS): Q3 meets on the top line and beats on the bottom line with a 23% Y/Y jump in revenue. Comp sales growth grew 21% versus last year, on solid sales of its Sleep Number brand. The company also guides FY12 EPS higher to the $1.51 - $1.53 range, above the $1.47 Street view. Shares +1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +9.6%) discloses chief sales officer Richard Singh has left the company, and...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +9.6%) discloses chief sales officer Richard Singh has left the company, and that sales personnel will report to new CEO Ralph Schmitt until a successor is found. Shares of the struggling and heavily-shorted solid-state drive vendor rallied strongly after diving yesterday on concerns about its delayed 10-Q filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • NVEC

    NVE (NASDAQ:NVEC): FQ2 EPS of $0.50 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $5.82M (-11.8% Y/Y) misses by...

    NVE (NASDAQ:NVEC): FQ2 EPS of $0.50 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $5.82M (-11.8% Y/Y) misses by $1.6M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM

    Albemarle (NYSE:ALB): Q3 EPS of $1.10 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $661.2M (-8.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Albemarle (NYSE:ALB): Q3 EPS of $1.10 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $661.2M (-8.4% Y/Y) misses by $9M. Shares -4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • PFBC

    Preferred Bank (NASDAQ:PFBC): Q3 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.04. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)

    Preferred Bank (NASDAQ:PFBC): Q3 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.04. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • ALGN

    Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q3 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $136.5M (+8.4% Y/Y)...

    Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q3 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $136.5M (+8.4% Y/Y) misses by $3.5M. Shares -13.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • GORO

    Gold Resource (NYSEMKT:GORO) -10.5% AH after downwardly revising its 2012 annual production...

    Gold Resource (NYSEMKT:GORO) -10.5% AH after downwardly revising its 2012 annual production outlook to 85K-100K gold equivalent oz. from its earlier view of 100K-120K oz., citing "the near-term challenge of dilution for the remainder of 2012." Q3 production of ~22,300 oz. was a 64% increase over Q2's "less than optimal" production of 14,488 AuEq oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): FQ2 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $543.9M (-2% Y/Y) misses by...

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): FQ2 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $543.9M (-2% Y/Y) misses by $3.7M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • SYK

    More on Stryker (NYSE:SYK): Q3 meets on the top line but misses on a per shares basis, as...

    More on Stryker (NYSE:SYK): Q3 meets on the top line but misses on a per shares basis, as strength in the U.S. was mostly offset by weaker sales overseas. The company lowers its FY12 expectations, now seeing an EPS of $4.04 - $4.07, below the Street view of $4.09. For FY13, it expects EPS of $4.25 - $4.40, also below the consensus of $4.45. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • LRCX

    Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX): FQ4 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $906.9M (+22.3% Y/Y)...

    Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX): FQ4 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $906.9M (+22.3% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • EXPO

    Exponent (NASDAQ:EXPO): Q3 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $73.3M (+11% Y/Y) beats by...

    Exponent (NASDAQ:EXPO): Q3 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $73.3M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • EBAY

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q3 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.4B (+15% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q3 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.4B (+15% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDT

    Given Imaging (GIVN) says it's exploring strategic alternatives including possible merger or...

    Given Imaging (GIVN) says it's exploring strategic alternatives including possible merger or sale of the company. Preliminary indications of interest have already been received from a number of parties. The company intends to continue to actively explore these and other alternatives, including a strategic alliance or additional acquisitions. The Board has appointed an executive committee to oversee the process. Barclays is assisting in the process. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS): Q3 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $246.8M (+23.6% Y/Y) in-line....

    Select Comfort (SCSS): Q3 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $246.8M (+23.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • ADGE

    American DG Energy (ADGE +7.5%) moves up after reaching an agreement to provide chilled water to...

    American DG Energy (ADGE +7.5%) moves up after reaching an agreement to provide chilled water to Doral Arrowwood Hotel and Conference Center, which will be owned and operated by ADGE.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • BMI

    Flow-measurement manufacturer Badger Meter (BMI +15%) jumps after reporting Q3 results that beat...

    Flow-measurement manufacturer Badger Meter (BMI +15%) jumps after reporting Q3 results that beat estimates across the board. Profit was boosted by a 77% jump in revenue, as all three of its product categories contributed to improvement. Bottom line margins also benefited from lower copper prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +4.2%) announces it is increasing spot market base prices for all carbon...

    AK Steel (AKS +4.2%) announces it is increasing spot market base prices for all carbon flat-rolled steel products by $40/ton, effective immediately with new orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +2.3%) is closing higher after Wedge Partners argues the company's closely-watched...

    Facebook (FB +2.3%) is closing higher after Wedge Partners argues the company's closely-watched mobile ad business is "near a positive inflection [point]." Facebook has been scrambling to roll out new mobile ad formats as PC usage slips in the U.S. and other markets thanks in large part to growing mobile use - mobile Sponsored Stories has been the company's biggest success on this front. Today, Facebook officially launched its mobile app download ad product. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 5 Comments
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK +6.3%) race higher with chatter circulating around that OTR...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK +6.3%) race higher with chatter circulating around that OTR Global sees sales in China improving. Squeezed on margins, the company needs demand to hold up so that it can avoid having to cut prices to clear Ugg boots from inventory. (DECK chart of the day: revenue vs. inventory)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • YPF

    Argentina's YPF (YPF +3.7%) reportedly expects to receive government approval to more than...

    Argentina's YPF (YPF +3.7%) reportedly expects to receive government approval to more than double natural gas prices to help fund expansions. YPF is basing a $37B five-year investment plan on a doubling of the average gas price, while the Neuquen province - home to the Vaca Muerta shale formation - is making the same assumption for its budget next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • BAC

    Financials (XLF +1.2%) lead today's sectors and extend their lead as 2012's top performer, now...

    Financials (XLF +1.2%) lead today's sectors and extend their lead as 2012's top performer, now up 25% YTD and 33% over the past 12 months. While investors struggle to gain clarity on BofA's (BAC -0.1%) prospects, M&T Bank (MTB +5.6%) and BNY Mellon (BK +5.2%) rank among the day’s big gainers after both reported strong quarters. C +3%, GS +1%, JPM +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • HOV

    Everything to do with homebuilding moves up today on September's housing data surge: Hovanian...

    Everything to do with homebuilding moves up today on September's housing data surge: Hovanian (HOV +9.5%), KB Home (KBH +8.3%), Toll Bros. (TOL +2.5%), Ryland (RYL +4.4%), Standard Pacific (SPF +3.8%) and Meritage Homes (MTH +3.4%) all trade higher, as well as makers of fixtures like faucets and cabinets: Masco (MAS +1.4%), Fortune Brands Home & Security (FBHS +3%) and American Woodmark (AMWD +3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • TITN

    Titan Machinery (TITN +4%) says it's received approval from CNH International to form Titan...

    Titan Machinery (TITN +4%) says it's received approval from CNH International to form Titan Machinery Ukraine, Ltd. to serve as a CaseIH agricultural product distributor in the Ukraine.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS -2.2%) says it's submitted an amendment to the Risk Evaluation and Mitigation...

    Vivus (VVUS -2.2%) says it's submitted an amendment to the Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy for its obesity drug Qsymia. The proposed REMS modification would allow dispensing through a broader range of certified pharmacies, specifically select retail pharmacies, to increase access while meeting all requirements of the REMS. The REMS modification was made at the mutual request of VIVUS and the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • DG

    Discounters take a beating with chatter picking up steam tipping off that companies in the...

    Discounters take a beating with chatter picking up steam tipping off that companies in the sector are talking down holiday sales at an industry event and hedge funds are beginning to increase the pace they trim holdings of sector names. Dollar General (DG -3.9%) leads the charge lower, with Family Dollar (FDO -3.1%) and Dollar Tree (DLTR -1%) also showing weakness.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +8.1%) is up sharply today. Possibly helping its cause is a deal to supply...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +8.1%) is up sharply today. Possibly helping its cause is a deal to supply 3K base stations for China Mobile's (NYSE:CHL) TD-LTE 4G trials. Though Alcatel is just one of 7 suppliers for the trial - Ericsson and Nokia Siemens are among the others - Alcatel claims it will provide "the largest share of base stations." China Mobile's commercial 4G rollout, whose timetable depends on regulators, is guaranteed to be huge.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • SGEN

    Seatle Genetics (SGEN +1.5%) moves up today after saying it's initiated its Phase II clinical...

    Seatle Genetics (SGEN +1.5%) moves up today after saying it's initiated its Phase II clinical trial for Adcertris, a drug candidate to be used as a front-line therapy for patients age 60 or older with newly diagnosed Hodgkin lymphoma.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -5.3%) is slipping on the second day of its big trial against Google. Shares are...

    Vringo (VRNG -5.3%) is slipping on the second day of its big trial against Google. Shares are down 22% from their Oct. 9 high, but still well above where they were before Google's request for a summary judgment was denied. SA's Steve Kim recently estimated the trial is set to last roughly 2 weeks, and noted Vringo is aiming for the moon by seeking a royalty rate of 3.5% on Google AdWords revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 30 Comments
  • JVA

    Shares of Coffee Holdings (JVA +6.1%) shoot higher with word that Green Mountain Coffee Roasters...

    Shares of Coffee Holdings (JVA +6.1%) shoot higher with word that Green Mountain Coffee Roasters could be moving into global markets. The two stocks tend to move in tandem due to the significant amount of business they conduct together.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +8.6%) rallies after an executive hiring suggests...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +8.6%) rallies after an executive hiring suggests international growth is on the company's plate. Though it acknowledges that it's looking at opportunities outside of North America, Green Mountain has been cryptic over where the focus may be.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 10 Comments
  • PJC

    Boutique investment bank Piper Jaffray (PJC +8.5%) moves up after its Q3 swung to a profit,...

    Boutique investment bank Piper Jaffray (PJC +8.5%) moves up after its Q3 swung to a profit, easily topping expectations on strength in its banking and brokerage operations. CEO Andrew Duff attributed much of the positive results to the firm's "robust" fixed-income performance in its institutional-brokerage business.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • CYMI

    Midday top 10 gainers: CYMI +51%. SIFY +27%. MTG +22%. IGLD +21%. BCOM +21%. TSRI +20%. REDF...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CYMI +51%. SIFY +27%. MTG +22%. IGLD +21%. BCOM +21%. TSRI +20%. REDF +14%. BMI +14%. URI +14%. DF +13.
    Top 10 Losers: FTNT -20%. APOL -19%. DSTI -14%. CHKP -12%. INVE -11%. OSG -11%. FIRE -10%. STLY -8%. MARK -8%. TXT -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • SIFY

    Sify Technologies (SIFY +26.2%) soars after reporting FQ2 revenue of INR2.06B ($39M - +13% Y/Y)...

    Sify Technologies (SIFY +26.2%) soars after reporting FQ2 revenue of INR2.06B ($39M - +13% Y/Y) and a net loss of INR45M ($852K - excludes a one-time investment gain). The Indian ISP/IT services firm saw 22% Y/Y growth for its Software Services business. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON -1.6%) suspends soybean royalty collections in Brazil while it appeals a state...

    Monsanto (MON -1.6%) suspends soybean royalty collections in Brazil while it appeals a state court ruling on intellectual property rights siding with a group of growers that a patent on first-generation Roundup Ready soybeans had expired. MON expects appellate courts to decide whether collections can resume over the next several weeks, prior to the start of an actual trial.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • AAV-OLD

    The rise in shares of Advantage Oil & Gas (AAV-OLD +4.8%) is attributed to Exxon...

    The rise in shares of Advantage Oil & Gas (AAV-OLD +4.8%) is attributed to Exxon Mobil's acquisition of most of Celtic Exploration, including 545K net acres in the liquids-rich Montney shale. AAV, the fifth-largest Montney producer, rallied in August on news it was seeking a buyer for some assets to simplify its structure and prepare for a potential sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • DDC

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD +7%) is looking to sell its watch and jewelry business to concentrate...

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD +7%) is looking to sell its watch and jewelry business to concentrate on its mining business, and has been approaching potential buyers such as luxury groups LVMH and PPR, Reuters reports. HWD, which owns 40% of Canada's Diavik diamond mine, posted a lower quarterly profit and said luxury demand has slowed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • INTC

    Intel (INTC -2.7%) remains lower following its Q3 report, which was accompanied by soft guidance...

    Intel (INTC -2.7%) remains lower following its Q3 report, which was accompanied by soft guidance and cautious earnings call remarks (I, II) about demand and inventories. Dell (DELL-OLD -1.6%) and Nvidia (NVDA -1.7%) are off, but most other PC industry names are near breakeven. There's plenty of downbeat sell-side commentary: Goldman predicts margins will fall further in 1H13, and Nomura thinks Intel's declining cash balance (now at $3.4B) will limit stock buybacks. Bulls are predicting Windows 8, for which expectations have fallen considerably, will provide a lift.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST -0.2%) show no ill effect from the candid remarks made by...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST -0.2%) show no ill effect from the candid remarks made by PepsiCo execs on the firm's earnings call pointing to a lack of interest in pursuing M&A activity in the energy drink space. If Coca-Cola (previous) and PepsiCo are scratched out as buyers of Monster, it would appear the leading candidate could be Anheuser-Busch InBev (BUD -0.4%) - a company facing a matured beer market in the U.S. and potentially in need of a jolt of energy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • NABI

    Nabi Biopharmaceuticals (NABI +1.1%) recovers from its pre-open dip, now trading higher despite...

    Nabi Biopharmaceuticals (NABI +1.1%) recovers from its pre-open dip, now trading higher despite its earlier announcement that Phase 2 studies of its smoking-cessation vaccine didn't meet the primary endpoint, creating another setback for the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • DF

    More on Dean Foods' (DF +13.4%) WhiteWave-Alpro IPO: The company says its expects the 20M shares...

    More on Dean Foods' (DF +13.4%) WhiteWave-Alpro IPO: The company says its expects the 20M shares of WhiteWave-Alpro to price in a range of $14 to $16. The seller of dairy products will list on the NYSE under the symbol WWAV. (8-K)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • CREE

    Several LED industry stocks jump in response to Cree's (CREE +12.3%) FQ1 results and FQ2...

    Several LED industry stocks jump in response to Cree's (CREE +12.3%) FQ1 results and FQ2 guidance: winners include Rubicon (RBCN +3.4%), SemiLEDs (LEDS +7.2%), Aixtron (AIXG +3.4%), and GT Advanced (GTAT +2%). Investors might also be taking heart in Cree's earnings call remarks about short lead times, in-line LED price declines, and strong LED lighting demand - the industry has been hammered by intense price declines in recent years.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • DF

    Shares of Dean Foods (DF +13.2%) spike higher after the company files (8-K) preliminary results...

    Shares of Dean Foods (DF +13.2%) spike higher after the company files (8-K) preliminary results for its WhiteWave-Alpro segment, poised for an IPO. In the latest quarter, the unit saw revenue jump 13% to $598M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • EXK

    Endeavour Silver (EXK -3.7%) gives back yesterday's gains after AuRico Gold (AUQ +1.7%) says it...

    Endeavour Silver (EXK -3.7%) gives back yesterday's gains after AuRico Gold (AUQ +1.7%) says it sold its ~11.1% equity interest in the company (11M common shares). EXK had announced Q3 production increases of 33% in silver and 139% in gold Y/Y; revenues rose 34% due to the higher metal production and the partial sale of bullion inventory.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 4 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +3.8%) adds to yesterday's gains on news it has won a contract to build a 13MW...

    First Solar (FSLR +3.8%) adds to yesterday's gains on news it has won a contract to build a 13MW solar plant for the Dubai Electric and Water Authority. The project is set to be finished by Oct. '13, and could pave the way for future deals: Dubai has begun work on a solar park it hopes will eventually produce 1GW of electricity.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 4 Comments
  • DGX

    More on Quest Diagnostics (DGX -3.8%) Q3: net profit -5.1% to $163.1M due to restructuring and...

    More on Quest Diagnostics (DGX -3.8%) Q3: net profit -5.1% to $163.1M due to restructuring and integration charges of $0.17/share. Clinical-testing revs -2.1%, requisitions volume -1.1%, revs per requisition -1%. Cuts FY EPS guidance by $0.05 at the top end and now expects $4.45-$4.55 vs. consensus of $4.56. Cuts revenue growth projection to 0.5% from 1%-2%, which would equate to $7.89B vs. consensus of $7.64B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -6%) dips on a downgrade to Neutral this morning from Summer Street,...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -6%) dips on a downgrade to Neutral this morning from Summer Street, saying it sees only a 50% chance the FDA panel will vote to approve it hypercholesterolemia drug Kynamro.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • URI

    Shares of United Rentals (URI +10.5%) ride the firm's profit-busting Q3 to a double-digit gain...

    Shares of United Rentals (URI +10.5%) ride the firm's profit-busting Q3 to a double-digit gain as demand for industrial and commercial rental equipment exceeded expectations. By the looks of it, the acquisition of RSC Holdings is paying off for the company with margin improvement now front and center.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • APOL

    Education stocks get hammered in early trading after Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL) slashes revenue...

    Education stocks get hammered in early trading after Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL) slashes revenue estimates and closes many of its physical locations. It's also possible traders could be reading something into the soft answers given by both candidates at last night's Presidential debate when college funding was tied into the lead-off question. Naturally, analysts see Romney taking a harder line on federal funding if elected but also contend a 2nd term for Obama is no easy ride for federal backing of the sector. Decliners: APOL -15.5%, DV -5.1%, STRA -5.0%, ESI-OLD -4.1%, COCO -2.4%, CECO -1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • CHKP

    Check Point (CHKP -11.6%) joins security hardware peer Fortinet (FTNT -17.9%) in tumbling...

    Check Point (CHKP -11.6%) joins security hardware peer Fortinet (FTNT -17.9%) in tumbling post-earnings. Though Check Point's Q3 results were respectable, the firewall vendor guided on its call for Q4 revenue of $355M-$387M and EPS of $0.84-$0.91 vs. a consensus of $381.8M and $0.90. The big question: to what extent is the guidance the result of soft IT spending and strong European exposure, and to what extent is it due to competition from Palo Alto Networks (PANW -1.2%) and its disruptive next-gen firewalls?
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • TXT

    More on Textron (TXT -5.3%) Q3: net profit +6% to $151M. Revenue breakdown: Bell helicopters...

    More on Textron (TXT -5.3%) Q3: net profit +6% to $151M. Revenue breakdown: Bell helicopters +20% to $1B, with 46 choppers delivered vs. 26 last year. Industrial revenue +4% to $683M. Systems, which sells UAVs and armored vehicles -13% to $400M. Cessna +1% to $778M after "very quiet ordering." Raises EPS FY outlook to $1.95-$2.05 from previous guidance of $1.80-$2, but still below consensus of $2.10.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • OSGB

    Overseas Shipholding (NYSE:OSG) continues its free-fall, -10.3% off the open after yesterday's...

    Overseas Shipholding (NYSE:OSG) continues its free-fall, -10.3% off the open after yesterday's 27% nosedive on reports it has maxed out its lending facilities and could soon face a liquidity squeeze ahead of upcoming maturities. Shares have now tumbled 69% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -6%) could receive a warning letter from the FDA about its manufacturing...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -6%) could receive a warning letter from the FDA about its manufacturing facility in Sylmar, California, where it produces defibrillators and pacemakers and which the FDA is inspecting. The news, which CEO Dan Starks disclosed on an earnings call, is not a surprise given the massive insulation problems St. Jude has had with the wires for its defibrillators.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • OBE

    Penn West (PWE) +2% premarket after updating its asset-sale program, saying it has agreements in...

    Penn West (PWE) +2% premarket after updating its asset-sale program, saying it has agreements in principle to sell certain non-core properties for ~C$1.3B. PWE does not identify the assets or the buyers, but confirms more than one sale was involved and that the properties currently yielded production of 12K boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) +2.2% after JMP starts coverage with an Outperform and $50...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) +2.2% after JMP starts coverage with an Outperform and $50 target. The OLED technology/materials provider, which depends heavily on Samsung's smartphone sales, sold off sharply during the second half of September.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures get a leg-up from strong housing starts, with the S&P...

    Market preview: Stock futures get a leg-up from strong housing starts, with the S&P benchmark +0.2%.     Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) +9.7% following its FQ1 report. Results were ho-hum, and so was guidance: the company expects FQ2 revenue of $320M-$340M and EPS of $0.27-$0.31 vs. a consensus of $333.6M and $0.30. But shares have been depressed, and Cree's improving gross margin (it rose 120 bps Q/Q to 37.5% in FQ1, and is expected to be around 38.5% in FQ2) is going over well. Needham sees the report as evidence Cree is executing well on its vertical integration plans. (transcript)

  • BHP

    BHP is unlikely to expand its Australian coal business given increasingly tough market...

    BHP is unlikely to expand its Australian coal business given increasingly tough market conditions and a slump in commodity prices, CEO Marius Kloppers says. Rising taxes, royalties, a strong Australian dollar and falling productivity mean that "further investment to grow these operations is much less likely,” and it will only operate mines that generate cash and remain profitable. BHP +2.1% premarket.
